headline: L3Harris Q4 Earnings Surpass Estimates, Revenues Increase Y/Y
summary: LHX's total revenues in the fourth quarter of 2024 beat the Zacks Consensus Estimate by 0.3%. The top line also increases 3.4% from the year-ago level.

headline: L3Harris (LHX) Q4 Earnings and Revenues Surpass Estimates
summary: L3Harris (LHX) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of 1.17% and 0.30%, respectively, for the quarter ended December 2024. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

headline: L3Harris forecasts upbeat annual sales on strong defense demand
summary: Demand for arms and military equipment has ballooned as a result of the Russia-Ukraine war and ongoing conflicts in the Middle East, benefiting defense contractors such as L3Harris.  The company also raised its cost-saving goal to $1.2 billion by the end of 2025, a year ahead of its previously disclosed timeline.  L3Harris said it had achieved $800 million in cost savings in 2024.

headline: L3Harris: Q4 Earnings Snapshot
summary: The average estimate of nine analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of $3.43 per share. The technology and communications company posted revenue of $5.52 billion in the period, also beating Street forecasts. Seven analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $5.51 billion.

raw.headline: L3Harris: Q4 Earnings Snapshot
raw.summary: The average estimate of nine analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of $3.43 per share. The technology and communications company posted revenue of $5.52 billion in the period, also beating Street forecasts. Seven analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $5.51 billion.

headline: L3Harris Technologies Reports Fourth Quarter and Full-Year 2024 Results, Initiates 2025 Guidance
summary: MELBOURNE, Fla., January 30, 2025--L3Harris Technologies (NYSE: LHX) reported fourth quarter 2024 diluted EPS of $2.37 on fourth quarter 2024 revenue of $5.5 billion. Fourth quarter 2024 non-GAAP diluted EPS was $3.47. Fourth quarter results reflect growth in the business and continued operational efficiencies driving margin improvement. Reconciliations of non-GAAP results are detailed in tables beginning on page 13.
